notes: Cannot reproduce: bug requires Windows UWP with Xamarin.Forms and ANGLE/EGL OpenGL backend (SKGLView + AngleSwapChainPanel). Current environment is macOS arm64 which cannot run UWP apps. The NuGet package (1.68.0-preview28) was verified to exist with uap10.0 TFM and ANGLE native binaries (libEGL.dll, libGLESv2.dll) for win10-x64/x86/arm. Triage indicates PR #1642 (merged 2021-03-30) likely addressed the root cause by making the EGL display static with initialize-once semantics and adding composition scale change deduplication. UWP and Xamarin.Forms are now deprecated platforms.

reproductionSteps.description: Assess platform feasibility — UWP requires Windows SDK and runtime, not available on macOS
reproductionSteps.output: Current environment: macOS 26.2 arm64. UWP (Universal Windows Platform) apps require: (1) Windows 10/11 OS, (2) Windows SDK, (3) Visual Studio with UWP workload. The bug involves AngleSwapChainPanel (a UWP XAML control), GlesContext.CreateSurface (ANGLE EGL on DirectX), and ViewExtensions.RotateYTo (Xamarin.Forms 3D transform). None of these components can run on macOS. Docker cannot help — UWP requires the Windows desktop compositor, not just a Windows container.

blockers: Requires Windows 10/11 with UWP SDK — current environment is macOS arm64 which cannot run UWP apps
Bug is in AngleSwapChainPanel (ANGLE/EGL on DirectX) — a Windows-only component that cannot be tested on macOS or in Docker
Requires Xamarin.Forms UWP renderer and ViewExtensions.RotateYTo which triggers SwapChainPanel.CompositionScaleChanged — this is the Windows desktop compositor, not available outside Windows

triageCorrections.upstream: Triage rated fix confidence at 0.8, noting PR #1642 was a partial fix with deliberately weakened GRContext cleanup
triageCorrections.corrected: Cannot verify fix status from macOS. The partial nature of the fix (author explicitly noted it was incomplete) means confidence should remain at 0.8 or lower until verified on Windows UWP.
